intro: Diodia teres f. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smoothleaf diodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The leaves are typically smooth and lance-shaped, giving the plant its common name. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, sandy soils. This plant is often found in open woodlands and along the edges of wetlands.
